title: Lay morals, and other papers,
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: a most bitter satire upon Sir John Leslie, in which he was compared to Falstaff, charged with puffing himself ,and very prettily censured for publishing only the first volume of a class-book, and making all purchasers pay for both. Sir John Leslie took up the matter angrily, visited Carfrae the publisher, and threatened him with an action, till he was forced to turn the hapless Lapsus out of doors. The maltreated periodical found shelter in the shop of Huie, Infirmary Street; and No. xvii.
